block.p: May 20 through June 25

ANNUAL NEW JERSEY RENAISSANCE KINGDOM -- A Renaissance festival, featuring more than 20 shows a day (including a ''Living Chess Tournament'' and childrens' Fairy Tales). Daily, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Tickets: $12; $8 for older people; $6 for children under 12; $18 for a two-day pass; $40 for a season pass. Exit 10 Off I-287, Davidson Avenue, Somerset. (732) 271-1119.
May 22
May 20 through June 25

ANNUAL NEW JERSEY RENAISSANCE KINGDOM -- A Renaissance festival, featuring more than 20 shows a day (including a ''Living Chess Tournament'' and childrens' Fairy Tales). Daily, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Tickets: $12; $8 for older people; $6 for children under 12; $18 for a two-day pass; $40 for a season pass. Exit 10 Off I-287, Davidson Avenue, Somerset. (732) 271-1119.
May 22
DAVID DANIELS -- Countertenor. Tickets: $25 and $28. McCarter Theater, 91 University Place, Princeton. (609) 683-8000.
May 26 through June 4

CRAFT CONCEPTS 2000: TREASURES OF TOMORROW -- Includes glass works, ceramics, basketry, toys, jewelry, leather and more. 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Tickets: $3; $2 for those 12 to 17; free for older people and children under 12. Noyes Museum, Lily Lake Road, Oceanville. (609) 652-8848.
May 27 through May 29

AMERICAN INDIAN ARTS FESTIVAL -- More than 150 artists and entertainers from 50 tribal nations. Daily, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Tickets: $10; $5 for those under 12 and older people. Rankokus Indian Reservation, Burlington County. (609) 261-4747 or www.powhatan.org.
MAY 31
THE FLYING KARAMAZOV BROTHERS -- Comedians that blend music and theater with physical stunts and science. Tickets: $25 to $30. McCarter Theater, 91 University Place, Princeton. (609) 683-8000.
June 2 through 4
RIVERFEST 2000 -- Food, bands, crafts, rides, games and river cruises. Friday, 5 to 10 p.m.; Saturday, 11 a.m. to 10 p.m.; Sunday, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Free. Marine Park, Red Bank. (888) 438-3378.
June 3
DAVID GRISMAN QUINTET -- The mandolinist and his quintet. Tickets: $23 to $28. McCarter Theater, 91 University Place, Princeton. (609) 683-8000.
June 3 and 4

MICHAEL ARNONE'S 10TH ANNUAL CRAWFISH FEST -- Bands and 15,000 pounds of boiled crawfish. 10 A.M. to 7 P.M. Tickets: $25; $20 in advance; $35 for two-day pass. Waterloo Village Concert Field, Stanhope. (212) 539-8830 or www.crawfishfest.com. June 4

KATE GORRIE BUTTERFLY HOUSE -- Grand opening. A seasonal structure covering 1,500-square feet and featuring butterflies and plants. 1 p.m. Free. Stony Brook Millstone Watershed Association, 31 Titus Mill Road, Pennington. (609) 737-3735.

POLISH HERITAGE FESTIVAL -- Features bands, food, dancing, events for children (pony rides and fun houses), and car shows. 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Tickets: $10; free for children under 10. PNC Bank Arts Center, Holmdel. (732) 251-9200 or www.polfest.com/index.html.

TRAILSIDE PLANETARIUM -- ''Become a Lunatic,'' an exploration of the moon. 2 and 3:30 p.m. Tickets: $3; $2.55 for older people. Trailside Nature and Science Center, 452 New Providence Road, Mountainside. (908) 789-3670.
June 4 through July 29

NEW JERSEY INTERNATIONAL FILM FESTIVAL SUMMER 2000 -- More than 40 films, including international films, American independent features, experimental and short subjects, classic revivals, and documentaries, screened at four sites. Also includes talks by visiting directors and film and video workshops (732) 932-8482 or www.rci.rutgers.edu/nigrin.
June 7 through July 23
PIPPIN -- Musical theater. Tickets: $36 to $60. Paper Mill Playhouse, Brookside Drive, Millburn. (973) 376-4343.
June 7 through Aug. 30

MOVIES UNDER THE STARS -- New films, classics and movies for children are screened every Wednesday at dusk. Free; take blanket or lawn chair. Erie Lackawanna Plaza, in front of train station, Hoboken. (201) 420-2207.
June 10 and 11
NEW JERSEY FRESH SEAFOOD FESTIVAL -- 10 a.m. to 8 p.m. Historic Gardner's Basin, New Hampshire Avenue, Atlantic City. (609) 347-4386.
June 13 through 18
THE WHO'S TOMMY -- Musical theater. Tickets: $12 to $58. New Jersey Performing Arts Center, 1 Center Street, Newark. (888) 466-5722.
June 13 through Dec. 17

NEW JERSEY SHAKESPEARE FESTIVAL -- Including ''The Forest,'' by Alexander Ostrovsky (June 13 to July 2); ''Twelfth Night'' (July 11 to 30); ''Rhinoceros,'' by Eugene Ionesco (Aug. 8 to 27); ''Antony and Cleopatra'' (Sept. 5 to 30); and others. Plays run June 13 to Dec. 17. Call or visit Web site for schedule and ticket information. F. M. Kirby Shakespeare Theater, Drew University, 36 Madison Avenue, Madison. (973) 408-5600 or www.njshakespeare.org.
June 14

THE SUMMER SKY -- Learn about Mercury and find out what constellations and other planets will be visible in the warm nights of summer. 8:30 to 10 p.m. For ages 6 and up. Tickets: $4. Meet at the planetarium. Trailside Nature and Science Center, 452 New Providence Road, Mountainside. (908) 789-3670.

ROBERT CRAIS -- The author of eight previous novels -- and television shows like ''L.A. Law'' and ''Hill Street Blues'' -- discusses his new novel, ''Demolition Angel.'' 7 p.m. Bookends, 232 East Ridgewood Avenue, Ridgewood. (201) 445-0726.
JUNE 15
THE STEVE MILLER BAND -- Rock. 8 p.m. Tickets: $20.50 to $45. PNC Bank Arts Center, Holmdel. (732) 335-8698.
June 16
THE JVC JAZZ FESTIVAL -- Al Di Meola's New World Sinfonia and Ron Affif Trio. 8 p.m. Tickets: $28 to $38. John Harms Center for the Arts, 30 North Van Brunt Street, Englewood. (201) 567-5797.
June 17 and 18

NEW JERSEY HOOP-IT-UP -- 3-on-3 basketball tournament, featuring more than 60 courts. Kean University, 1000 Morris Avenue, Union. For information, or to register, call (888) 997-7529, or visit www.hoopitup.com.
June 17 through July 23
OPERA FESTIVAL OF NEW JERSEY -- McCarter Theater, 91 University Place, Princeton. (856) 683-8000.
June 18

TRAILSIDE PLANETARIUM -- ''Become a Lunatic,'' 2 p.m., an exploration of the moon; ''The Reason for the Seasons,'' 3:30 p.m. Tickets: $3; $2.55 for older people. Trailside Nature and Science Center, 452 New Providence Road, Mountainside. (908) 789-3670.
June 20
NO DOUBT -- Rock and ska. 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $37.50. PNC Bank Arts Center, Holmdel. (732) 335-8698.
June 23
JVC JAZZ FESTIVAL -- Richard Bona and Friends, featuring Dianne Reeves. 8 p.m. Tickets: $18 to $38. John Harms Center for the Arts, 30 North Van Brunt Street, Englewood. (201) 567-5797.
June 24

WHITEWATER RAFTING IN LEHIGH RIVER GORGE -- The Stony Brook Millstone Watershed Association leads a five-hour rafting adventure. Saturday, 7:30 a.m. to 7 p.m. Tickets: $80; $70 for children 8 to 12. Information: (609) 737-3735.
June 24 and 25
ATLANTIC MUTUAL JAZZ FESTIVAL -- Tickets: $25; $45 for a two-day pass; free for children under 12. Fairleigh Dickinson University, Florham Park/Madison campus. (973) 543-2829.
June 25

TRAILSIDE PLANETARIUM -- ''Become a Lunatic,'' 2 p.m., an exploration of the moon; ''Spaceship Earth,'' 3:30 p.m., for children 4 to 6. Tickets: $3; $2.55 for older people. Trailside Nature and Science Center, 452 New Providence Road, Mountainside. (908) 789-3670.
June 25

NEW JERSEY IRISH FESTIVAL -- Featuring bands and a bagpipe competition, shopping in an Irish village, dancing and an Irish history exhibition center. Tickets: $12; $10 in advance; free for children under 10. PNC Bank Arts Center, Holmdel. (732) 785-9039 or www.njirish.com.
June 25
ERIC IDLE EXPLOITS MONTY PYTHON -- Comedian. Tickets: $25 to $55. New Jersey Performing Arts Center, 1 Center Street, Newark. (888) 466-5722.
June 27
STING -- Rock. 8 p.m. Tickets: $30.85 to $85.25. PNC Bank Arts Center, Holmdel. (732) 335-8698.
THE CHIEFTANS -- Traditional Irish music. 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $32 to $62.50. New Jersey Performing Arts Center, 1 Center Street, Newark. (888) 466-5722.
June 28 through July 1
CHASE SUMMER PARK CONCERTS -- The New Jersey Symphony Orchestra performs four concerts in different parks around the state. Information: (800) 255-3476.
June 30
TASTE OF GREECE FESTIVAL -- 30th annual festival of the Greek Orthodox Cathedral of St. John the Theologian, featuring Greek food, music and dance. 353 East Clinton Avenue, Tenafly. (201) 567-5072.
July 1 to Aug. 20

DREYFUSS PLANETARIUM -- ''Where in the World is Carmen Sandiego?'' A mystery planetarium show that takes place in outer space. Wednesdays through Fridays at 2:30 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays at 1 and 3 p.m. Tickets: $3; $1 for children. Newark Museum, 49 Washington Street, Newark. (973) 596-6550.
July 7
SHAWN COLVIN -- Rock. 8 p.m. Tickets: $18 to $36. John Harms Center for the Arts, 30 North Van Brunt Street, Englewood. (201) 567-5797.
July 7 - Aug. 5
BIG -- family musical based on the film with Tom Hanks. Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 2 p.m. Tickets: $12.50 to $16.
July 8
MARC ANTHONY -- Latin pop. 8 p.m. Tickets: $25 to $75. PNC Bank Arts Center, Holmdel. (732) 335-8698.
THE BACON BROTHERS -- Rock. 8 p.m. Tickets: $25. John Harms Center for the Arts, 30 North Van Brunt Street, Englewood. (201) 567-5797.
July 9

OCEAN GROVE'S 46TH ANNUAL CHOIR FESTIVAL -- 7:30 p.m. Featuring more than 2,000 singers from choirs around the country. Great Auditorium, Pilgrim and Ocean Pathways, Ocean Grove. (732) 988-0645 or www.oceangrove.org.
NATALIE MERCHANT -- Rock. 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $32 to $56. New Jersey Performing Arts Center, 1 Center Street, Newark. (888) 466-5722.
July 11 through 29
AMADEUS FESTIVAL -- The New Jersey Symphony Orchestra's annual all-Mozart concert series. Tickets: $15 to $48. Information: (800) 255-3476.
July 15
PATTY LARKIN, LUCY KAPLANSKY AND JOHN GORKA -- Folk singers and songwriters. 8 p.m. Tickets: $16 to $30. John Harms Center for the Arts, 30 North Van Brunt Street, Englewood. (201) 567-5797.
July 17 through 23
A. & P. TENNIS CLASSIC -- Featuring concerts by Randy Travis and the Beach Boys. Sheraton Crossroads Corporate Center, Mahwah. (201) 825-9100.
JETHRO TULL -- Rock. 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $28 to $50. New Jersey Performing Arts Center, 1 Center Street, Newark. (888) 466-5722.
July 19 and July 22
FUNGUS AMONG US -- Lectures and a field session, exploring the world of mushrooms. Stony Brook Millstone Watershed Association, 31 Titus Mill Road, Pennington. (609) 737-3735.
July 20 through 30

BRIGADOON -- Presented by the Westfield Young Artists Cooperative Theater and NJPAC's Summer Youth Performance Workshop. Tickets: $16; $8 for those under 14. New Jersey Performing Arts Center, 1 Center Street, Newark. (888) 466-5722.
JULY 24
OZZFEST 2000 -- Hard rock festival. Starts 10:20 a.m. Tickets: $45.25 to $70.25. PNC Bank Arts Center, Holmdel. (732) 335-8698.

RHYTHM OF THE NIGHT -- Jazz and rhythm-and-blues concert, featuring Will Downing and Chante Moore, singers, and Gerald Albright, saxophonist. 8 p.m. Tickets: $45 and $55. New Jersey Performing Arts Center, 1 Center Street, Newark. (888) 466-5722.
July 28 through 30

NEW JERSEY FESTIVAL OF BALLOONING -- Featuring the inflation and ascension of 125 hot air balloon, bands (Beach Boys and America), and fireworks. Tickets: $20; $15 in advance; $10 for children; $6 in advance for children. Call for schedule. Solberg Airport, Readington. (800) 468-2479 or www.balloonfestival.com.
July 29
DAMON WAYANS -- Comedian. 7 and 9:30 p.m. Tickets: $18 to $38. John Harms Center for the Arts, 30 North Van Brunt Street, Englewood. (201) 567-5797.
July 31
RED HOT CHILI PEPPERS -- Rock. Tickets: $30.50 and $40.50. PNC Bank Arts Center, Holmdel. (732) 335-8698.
Aug. 3 through 5
MIKHAIL BARYSHNIKOV AND THE WHITE OAK DANCE PROJECT -- Tickets: $45 to $50. McCarter Theater, 91 University Place, Princeton. (609) 683-8000.
Aug. 25

BIG TENT EVENT -- The Walt Whitman Cultural Arts Center presents rides, games, music, and a performance by the African American Stilt Walker Ballet. 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. Wiggins Park, Camden. (856) 964-8300.
Aug. 26
NICKELODEON ALL THAT MUSIC & MORE FESTIVAL -- 5 p.m. Call for tickets. PNC Bank Arts Center, Holmdel. (732) 335-8698.
